# Arpeggio: Major 7th in C#

---

## Brief Presentation
An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played in succession, rather than simultaneously. The Major 7th arpeggio in C# consists of the notes: C#, E#, G#, and B#.

---

## Notes and Intervals
- **C#** (Root)
- **E#** (Major 3rd above C#)
- **G#** (Perfect 5th above C#)
- **B#** (Major 7th above C#)

---

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Major 7th arpeggio in C# is commonly used in jazz, R&B, and fusion genres. It adds a sense of sophistication and color to the harmonic structure of a piece. The Major 7th quality has a smooth and dreamy sound, providing a sense of resolution and calmness.
